sentence.Network_en: Each brick also varies slightly in tone, texture and size.
sentence.Network_cn: 每块砖在色调、质地与大小上也都略有不同。

sentence.Network_en: In most languages adjectives have slightly different spellings for masculine and feminine.
sentence.Network_cn: 在多数语言中，形容词的阳性和阴性的拼法略为不同。

sentence.Network_en: Blake jumped in expertly; the boat dipped slightly under his weight.
sentence.Network_cn: 布莱克很熟练地跳上了船，他的重量使小船微微向下沉了沉。

entry.def: Slightly means to some degree but not to a very large degree.

example.ex: His family then moved to a slightly larger house...
example.tran: 然后他全家搬到了一个稍微大一点的房子里。

example.ex: They will be slightly more expensive but they last a lot longer...
example.tran: 它们的价钱要贵一些，可是更加耐用。

means.word_mean: 1. to a small degree or extent;

sentences.sentence: "the children argued because one slice of cake was slightly larger than the other"

means.word_mean: 2. in a slim or slender manner;

auth_sentence.content: The word "one" is only slightly younger.

Sentence.sentence: Sit under a tree, look at water, feel refreshed, ever so slightly renewed.
Its informal conversational style would make interaction comfortable, and yet the machine would remain slightly unpredictable and therefore interesting.
Its informal conversational style would make interaction comfortable, and yet the machine would remain slightly unpredictable and therefore interesting.
For the same reason, he placed the chairs close to each other and raised the temperature to a slightly uncomfortable level.

sentences.en: The number of passengers by this line fell off slightly in January.
sentences.cn: 一月份这条航线的乘客数量略有减少。

sentences.en: This one’s slightly better than that.
sentences.cn: 这一个比那个稍好一点。
